intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris f. nana, commonly known as the dwarf shepherd's purse, is a compact variant of the common shepherd's purse. It is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, rounded leaves and distinctive triangular seed pods. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few inches, making it suitable for rock gardens or as a ground cover. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Its botanical features make it an interesting addition to both wild and cultivated landscapes.
